result.execSummary:
The defendant Megan Ashley Sandbergh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Richland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Pay restitution, within 30 days, in the amount of $34.09, to Lone Rock Shell.

Pay costs.

Work towards getting driver's license.

Upon successful completion of probation, Defendant to be eligible for expungement per 973.015 and should follow up with the Clerk of Court regarding that procedure.

0 days credit in the event of revocation.

8/22/17 AMENDMENT requested by DOC and ordered by the Court: "$301.09 of court ordered financial obligations is payable to the DOC and $176 is payable to the Richland County Clerk of Courts." Clerk notes this is exactly the same breakdown as shown on the Assessment Report which was forwarded to DOC electronically at the time of sentencing.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Megan Ashley Sandbergh

records.addlTxt: Notice of Intent to Certify Debt to the Wisconsin Department of Revenue - Not Deliverable As Addressed, Unable to Forward

for Court Ordered Financial Obligations (signed this day by the Judge; clerk notes that civil judgment for unpaid costs was already entered on 4/5/18 per request of DOC agent's phone call and as allowed by the JOC)

SJ of DOC called this date, inquiring about status of civil judgment entry. DOC mailed civil judgment request in late February but it has not been received by the clerk. DOC needs to close out this account and verbally requests that the clerk take civil judgment on remaining costs as allowed by the language in the original JOC.
NOTICE OF FAILURE TO MEET CONDITIONS FOR EXPUNGEMENT
RETURN TO SENDER-NOTICE OF CERTIFICATION. CLERK UPDATED ADDRESS AND SENT BACK OUT.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
of Conviction - due requests "amend the JOC to indicate that $301.09 of court ordered financial obligations is payable to the DOC and $176 is payable to the Richland County Clerk of Courts."

Clerk will make this notation on the JOC but notes that it is unnecessary as the Assessment Report, which accompanied the JOC when it was transferred electronically to the DOC at the time of sentencing, clearly already states that $301.09 is payable to DOC and $176 is payable to the Clerk of Court.

Defendant Megan Ashley Sandbergh in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution.  Def pleads no contest to count 1.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Sentence withheld for 12 months probation.  Pay rest. in 30 days ($34.09 to LR Shell).  Pay costs.  Work towards getting dl.  Expungement to be afforded upon successful completion of probation.  0 days credit in the event of revocation.  Count 2 DRI.
Status conference on April 13, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Megan Ashley Sandbergh via written authorization. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. M states offer has been received from the DA; asks for status scheduling; def needs time to consider offer.  Atty. M enters NG pleas on def's behalf.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Megan Ashley Sandbergh in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Counsel request adjournment of this hearing to March 16th.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Megan Ashley Sandbergh in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Complt filed today - Atty. M requests for adj. of this appearance to give defense time to review the complaint.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
